newsitem.title: FINLAND: FINNISH JULY CONSUMER CONFIDENCE DOWN TO 15.4 PTS.
newsitem.headline: FINNISH JULY CONSUMER CONFIDENCE DOWN TO 15.4 PTS.

text.p: Finnish consumer confidence fell in July to 15.4 points from 15.9 points in June, Statistics Finland (SF) said in a statement on Thursday.

Consumer confidence is measured as the average of estimates on five variables: personal finances in the past year and coming year, the Finnish economy in the past and the coming year, and how advantageous it is to buy durable goods.
The consumer confidence indicator was 15.9 points in June, 15.5 points in May, 17.1 points in April, 15.6 points in March and 15.9 points in February.
